data.title: Entry value when NODE_ENV isn't supplied is lost in Atom's process.env.NODE_ENV
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

When  NODE_ENV isn't set and Atom is launched, [this line of code](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/6e6771ad5c913313de2bf83fecb38cdd0d6724b8/src/initialize-application-window.coffee#L20) changes process.env.NODE_ENV to 'production'. Packages/programs that assume that the absence of a NODE_ENV implies a development environment may not work correctly.

https://github.com/gandm/language-babel/issues/199

E.g. My package [language-babel](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/6e6771ad5c913313de2bf83fecb38cdd0d6724b8/src/initialize-application-window.coffee#L20) transpiles code using Babel. Babel assumes the absence of NODE_ENV to mean that process.env.NODE_ENV is 'development', but Atom changes this state to 'production' and hence the transpiles may loose information such as source maps.

**Expected behavior:**

Can the above line be removed. It appears a hangover from when Atom used React and as far as I can see atom itself makes no use of this setting. If that isn't possible, the starting state needs to be recorded somewhere accessible to packages.
### Versions

All versions on all platforms.

data.title: Saving a file with CTRL+S consistently crashes Atom (Windows 7 Enterprise Service Pack 1)
data.body:
### Description

I downloaded a fresh installation of Atom and edited my first (Markdown) file with it.
Saving the file with CTRL+S consistently crashes Atom.
Not a very good first interaction with the editor on Windows...
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Download Atom
2. Install on Windows
3. Edit file
4. Press CTRL+S (In both 'normal' and 'safe' mode)

**Expected behavior:** The file is saved

**Actual behavior:** The editor crashes
### Versions

![clipboard01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1651235/15818611/ae874164-2bde-11e6-851e-c050a49694f4.jpg)
![clipboard02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1651235/15818610/ae86e8ae-2bde-11e6-99d7-9ae4128d4127.jpg)

data.title: Patch Linux Environment When Atom Is Not Launched From A Shell Environment
data.body:
Atom can't see my environment variables when starting it via GUI (icon in applications menu)

For example there is problem with go-plus package which can't see GOPATH env variable.

Exec Environment:
Fedora 23 x64
Atom    : 1.7.4
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
DE: GNOME Shell 3.18.5
shell: ZeroShell

Here is some outputs from Atoms dev console 
- Starting Atom from Gnome:

```
process.env['GOPATH']
undefined
process.env['PATH']
"/usr/lib64/qt-3.3/bin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/bin:/usr/sbin:/home/den/.rvm/bin:/home/den/bin"
```
- Starting Atom from Terminal

```
process.env['GOPATH']
"/home/den/projects/gohome"
process.env['PATH']
"/home/den/.autojump/bin:/opt/liteide/bin:/usr/lib64/qt-3.3/bin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/bin:/usr/sbin:/home/den/.local/bin:/home/den/bin:/usr/local/go/bin:/home/den/.fzf/bin:/home/den/.rvm/bin"
```

Haven't found here any topic/issue regarding this.
As we can see there might happen some major problems because of Atom can't see user env variables, locate tools, etc..

data.title: Why does react package not rank first?
data.body: I use Atom 1.7.4. I tried searching for and installing react. I was surprised that the package react was ranked 10th at 218448 downloads while packages with 19 to 24487 downloads precede it. I guess other users will be forced to turn to Google to find the right packages when Atom itself could be sufficient for recommending packages.

data.title: Can't highlight terms ending in a period
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ Y ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [ Y ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [ Y ] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [ Y ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ Y ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [ Y ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Syntax highlighting does not occur for terms ending in a period ( `.` ).  This is necessary for use cases such as powerpc assembly, in which some opcodes behave differently when suffixed with a period, and in some cases only function with a period.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Use a language highlighting package that looks for terms ending in '.', such as [language-powerpc-assembly](https://github.com/ruscur/language-powerpc-assembly)
2. Activate that language, type a term that should be highlighted (in my case, `addi`), and on a new line, a term that _should_ be highlighted that ends in a '.' (in my case, `stdcx.`)

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

Terms ending in a '.' should be highlighted just as terms that don't end in a '.' are.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

Terms ending in a '.' are not highlighted until numbers are added after, it seems that there is hardcoded checking for numbers after a '.'

![Example](http://imgur.com/gAPDMS7l.png)
### Versions

```
Atom    : 1.7.4
Electron: 0.36.12
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 3.5.1
git 2.8.3

Arch Linux running kernel 4.5.4
```

data.title: allow scrolling beyond end of file (feature request)
data.body:
### Description

When adding to the end of a file, I generally find it easier to focus when this does not happen at the very bottom of the Atom window and screen. 

In Sublime Text it is possible to scroll down until the last line of the file is displayed at the very top of the view.

I would love it if this feature made it into Atom (which I generally much prefer to Sublime nowadays). 
### Thanks

Thanks for the great work on Atom!

data.title: Create mixins @base-font-size @base-line-height for reuse
data.body: ### Prerequisites - [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)? - [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)? - [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)? - [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)? - [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)? - [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported? For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide. ### Description **UPDATE: A simple mixin proposed solution is located at** https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/11905#issuecomment-224336832 **PROBLEM: The functionality for `CMD +` is not accessible by packages and themes.** Instead, [it is hardcoded to modify `atom-text-editor` element for `font-size` by hardcoding `#px` pixel value](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/6f1c1fd0e0242b096f4781698066788b26af2fa4/src/workspace-element.coffee#L54). This does not allow the reuse of this functionality for custom packages and CSS. The proposed solution noted at https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/11905#issuecomment-224336832 is to move the variable it is modifying to a global mixin, for reuse at this same `atom-text-editor` element and `font-size` attribute. An example use-case: When resizing the font size with CMD-+ (or CMD-SHIFT-+), only the Editor window is resized - not the TreeView, Tabs, StatusBar, ScrollBar, Dialogs (Find, Packages, etc), or anything else. BEFORE: Atom default font... AFTER: pressing CMD-+ several times to greatly increase font size... ^- Only the Editor is resized, making the Treeview and Debugger and other dialogs extremely hard to read in screencasts/meetup presentations. This is really needed, especially for doing Meetups Presentations, Screencasts and even Screen sharing/Code pairing sessions. Just make a few CMD-+ to blow everything up to enormous size and everyone is happy. This was originally mentioned back in November 2015. > Does anyone know how could I make @font-size change along with zoom levels? E.g. ctrl+/-/scroll-up/down. Thanks! > https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/2530#issuecomment-153580043 If we compare to VSCode, VSCode resizes everything with CMD-+ (Editor window, TreeView, Tabs, StatusBar, Scrollbar, dialogs, and everything else). For example, here's VSCode before and after: BEFORE: VSCode default font size... AFTER: pressing CMD-+ a few times blows everything up large. ^- that's a fullscreen shot at 3840x2400! In summary, the root issue is that `CMD +` is modifying the base stylesheet directly. We cannot access this functionality with custom packages and custom CSS. If a mixin was used instead, simple CSS overrides for the user could reuse them, as noted above. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Open a code file 2. Press CMD-+ a few times **Expected behavior:** When pressing CMD-+, I expect a global mixin or some other variable to access for custom packages and custom CSS. **Actual behavior:** There is no global mixin - it is hardcoded to change the base stylesheet. ### Versions ``` $ atom --version Atom : 1.8.0 Electron: 0.36.8 Chrome : 47.0.2526.110 Node : 5.1.1 ```

data.title: Make CEF framework installer and move libcef outside of project
data.body:
For god sake make a separate installer for CEF to make users to treat libcef as a separate framework which is needed to install before installing any app using CEF just like some other apps require to install Microsoft .NET framework.

When I build apps using CEF app size becomes strongly not acceptable and nobody has ever came up with an idea to standardise way we use this framework.

While you have authority at Atom to do it and you can make others follow you ! Just imagine how many apps will shrink and how will it boost CEF based app development if you host CEF installer somewhere by versions and make standard way for apps to locate and use libcef in Windows (Linux is not problem at all) system or make request to download and install it.

data.title: Atom Premature Not Responding Dialog
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [X] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [X] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [X] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [X] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [X] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [X] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Atom consistently, prematurely, opens a dialog alerting me "The editor is not responsive" and asks me to keep waiting or to close. I experience this dialog before preforming any major action (listed in the 'Steps to Reproduce' section) and as soon as I click keep waiting the action finishes. If the application had waited a second more, the action would have been finished loading and there would be no need for the dialog.
### Steps to Reproduce

Actions that can be reproduced to trigger this issue:
- Opening Atom
- Closing Atom
- Create a File
- Delete a File
- Save a File
- Open a File
- Make a Folder
- Delete a Folder

**Expected behavior:** The application should preform the action, load and display the contents, only displaying the dialog when it's very confident the editor has become truly unresponsive.

**Actual behavior:** The dialog shows up while the application is finishing loading.
### Versions

Atom version 1.7.4
Windows 10

data.title: Atom hangs if right click menu is open for 30 seconds
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open Atom
2. Right click on the editor or tree view
3. Wait for about 30 seconds
4. Ubuntu / Atom gives the following error dialog:

![screenshot from 2016-06-04 22-37-14](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19609673/15801662/ec3be2a2-2aa4-11e6-947d-f0eabc956453.png)

It's possible to continue normally by clicking "keep waiting". I don't think Atom really crashes, so this dialog probably shouldn't appear. I think there's some sort of timeout _somewhere_ for something to happen after opening the right click menu. I haven't tested this on Windows / OS X.

Atom    : 1.7.4
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
Distributor ID: Ubuntu
Description:    Ubuntu 16.04 LTS
Release:    16.04
Codename:   xenial

EDIT: added version info.

data.title: Option/flag to disable direct write
data.body: There needs be an option/flag to disable direct write. Without it the fonts are not as crisp as I would like it. And while it may be the default option for chrome going forward, there should be an option to disable it.

data.title: apm command not working
data.body:
Mac osx system version 10.11
I installed the atom from official website and use it for a week.
Today, I want to write a self-package to do sth,so I follow the guide of atom.io.
However, I found the apm command in my cli is not working, that means, when I typed
`apm`
in my command line, nothing happened.
So I typed `which apm` to see where is this script file, it is in `/usr/local/bin/apm`, okay,
I typed this  `ls -l /usr/local/bin/apm` to see what file did it link?
Then, I found this file was link to `/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/apm/node_modules/.bin/apm`, and that is an empty file!
Of course, I `ln` the `/usr/local/bin/apm` to the right file `/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/apm/bin/apm` and now, everything is right.

I want to know is there any problem could lead to the `apm` command link to the wrong file?

data.title: Use apm@1.12.2 with Node v4 and npm v3 \o/
data.body:
```
                  __              __ __
                 /\ \            /\ \\ \
  ___     ___    \_\ \     __    \ \ \\ \
/' _ `\  / __`\  /'_` \  /'__`\   \ \ \\ \_
/\ \/\ \/\ \L\ \/\ \L\ \/\  __/    \ \__ ,__\
\ \_\ \_\ \____/\ \___,_\ \____\    \/_/\_\_/
 \/_/\/_/\/___/  \/__,_ /\/____/       \/_/


                                    __
                                  /'__`\
     ___   _____     ___ ___     /\_\L\ \
   /' _ `\/\ '__`\ /' __` __`\   \/_/_\_<_
   /\ \/\ \ \ \L\ \/\ \/\ \/\ \    /\ \L\ \
   \ \_\ \_\ \ ,__/\ \_\ \_\ \_\   \ \____/
    \/_/\/_/\ \ \/  \/_/\/_/\/_/    \/___/
             \ \_\
              \/_/
```

This bumps apm to 1.11.1, which includes atom/apm#562 and atom/apm#563. Since npm 3 flattens packages by default, the build had to change relatively significantly, and I'm sure there are more edge cases to track down. This also bumps Atom's own npm to 3.9.5.

Of particular note, I removed the `apm clean` command that runs as part of the build. It didn't seem to be working in the first place, and seems to have trouble with npm 3's package flattening; maybe we can delegate to `npm prune` here. Since published builds get built from scratch, I think this is probably not a huge deal.

@atom/core, @atom/feedback, @damieng, I would love for you to pull down this branch and try to build Atom and make sure it runs correctly and that package-related operations work. It's _extremely likely_ you will have to run `script/clean` first; sorry, things are just too different.

Fixes #5109
Makes #7822 (more) possible
Probably a bunch of others too

data.title: Multiple Navigation shortcuts do not work on Windows
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

I was going through the Atom Flight Manual's "[moving in Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/using-atom/sections/moving-in-atom/)" section and several of the shortcuts don't work on Windows. I'll list a couple examples, but it's probably worth going through the examples in the document on Windows.

For example, `ALT` + `Right` moves to the end of the word and that works great! But `CMD` + `Right` is supposed to move to the end of the line. In mapping that to Windows I assumed that would be `CTRL` + `Right` but that doesn't work. Neither does `CTRL` + `e`. I also tried `CTRL` + `ALT` + `Right` just in case but that just changed the orientation of my screen to sideways which really sucks. :stuck_out_tongue: 
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a text document in Atom on Windows
2. Move the cursor to the middle of a line.
3. Hit the key combo `CTRL` + `Right`

**Expected behavior:** Cursor moves to the end of the line.

**Actual behavior:** Cursor moves to the end of the word.
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.
- Atom Version 1.7.4
- Windows 10

data.title: TextEditor removing folded blocks when deleting preceding lines
data.body:
### Description

When you have a folded code block and delete lines using OS X "forward delete", `Fn-Delete`, the whole block is deleted when the blank line preceding the folded block is deleted.

This is 100% reproducible for all grammars (tested on Python & JavaScript).
### Steps to Reproduce

Starting with code like:

```
# Blank line
<line for the folded block of code>
```

Delete the blank line using `fn+delete`, both the blank line and the folded block are deleted.

**Expected behavior:**

Not deleting the folded block.

**Actual behavior:**
### Versions

apm --version

```
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.8.0-rc2
```

atom --version

```
Atom    : 1.7.4
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
```

OSX El Capitan 10.11.5

data.title: Ctrl-/ on entire HTML style block uses CSS comment syntax
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Atom's comment command (Ctrl-/ by default) uses CSS comment syntax when used on an HTML style block instead of the HTML comment syntax. See the gif below:

![hjan6lansi](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2991842/15781496/5e61d652-2974-11e6-846e-a02f838dd60a.gif)

This bug occurs as long as there is at least one character (including whitespace characters) between the tags. If the block is completely empty, this issue does not occur.

Commenting out individual CSS rules within the style block works correctly (using the CSS syntax).
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a new or existing document with HTML syntax highlighting
2. Find or write an HTML style block that does not just immediately close (just a space or even a newline between the tags is sufficient to reproduce this issue)
3. Select the entire style block (from opening to closing tags)
4. Press Ctrl-/ (Editor: Toggle Line Comments)

**Expected behavior:** HTML comment syntax is used to comment out the style tag

**Actual behavior:** CSS comment syntax is used to (incorrectly) comment out the style tag
### Versions

Atom 1.7.4
apm 1.9.2
Windows 7 Pro SP1

data.title: French Keyboard Layout can't wrote } or ].
data.body:
### Description

It is impossible to write the symbols "}" and "]" with a French keyboard.
Im sad. :cry: 

French Keyboard Layout : http://f.tqn.com/y/french/1/S/m/H/2/frenchkeyboard.jpg
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Switch to french layout
2. Ctrl + Alt + =
3. Wrap your code instead of writing a "}".

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
}
**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
Code wrap
### Versions

1.7.4
Windows 7

Tanks ! :smile: 

Alex in :heart: with Atom.

data.title: Atom fails to build on 64-bit FreeBSD 10.3; node-gyp and python2 issues
data.body:
Hi,

I followed the [freebsd.md build guide](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/docs/build-instructions/freebsd.md) and installed a few extra deps I thought may be missing, namely I ran:

``` bash
sudo pkg install node npm libgnome-keyring gcc make python2
sudo npm install -g node-gyp
sudo npm config set python /usr/local/bin/python2 -g
```

then I got the source code of Atom 1.7.4 and cd'ed into it, via running:

``` bash
curl -OL https://github.com/atom/atom/archive/v1.7.4.tar.gz
tar -xzf v1.7.4.tar.gz
cd atom-1.7.4
```

Finally I ran:

``` bash
script/build
```

and received the output:

``` bash
Node: v5.11.1
npm: v2.13.3
Installing build modules...
gyp ERR! configure error 
gyp ERR! stack Error: Command failed: /usr/local/bin/python2 -c import platform; print(platform.python_version());
gyp ERR! stack Traceback (most recent call last):
gyp ERR! stack   File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
gyp ERR! stack AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'python_version'
gyp ERR! stack 
gyp ERR! stack     at ChildProcess.exithandler (child_process.js:202:12)
gyp ERR! stack     at emitTwo (events.js:100:13)
gyp ERR! stack     at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:185:7)
gyp ERR! stack     at maybeClose (internal/child_process.js:850:16)
gyp ERR! stack     at Socket.<anonymous> (internal/child_process.js:323:11)
gyp ERR! stack     at emitOne (events.js:90:13)
gyp ERR! stack     at Socket.emit (events.js:182:7)
gyp ERR! stack     at Pipe._onclose (net.js:484:12)
gyp ERR! System FreeBSD 10.3-RELEASE
gyp ERR! command "/usr/local/bin/node" "/usr/home/fusion809/atom-1.7.4/build/node_modules/npm/node_modules/node-gyp/bin/node-gyp.js" "rebuild"
gyp ERR! cwd /usr/home/fusion809/atom-1.7.4/build/node_modules/runas
gyp ERR! node -v v5.11.1
gyp ERR! node-gyp -v v2.0.2
gyp ERR! not ok 
gyp ERR! configure error 
gyp ERR! stack Error: Command failed: /usr/local/bin/python2 -c import platform; print(platform.python_version());
gyp ERR! stack Traceback (most recent call last):
gyp ERR! stack   File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
gyp ERR! stack AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'python_version'
gyp ERR! stack 
gyp ERR! stack     at ChildProcess.exithandler (child_process.js:202:12)
gyp ERR! stack     at emitTwo (events.js:100:13)
gyp ERR! stack     at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:185:7)
gyp ERR! stack     at maybeClose (internal/child_process.js:850:16)
gyp ERR! stack     at Socket.<anonymous> (internal/child_process.js:323:11)
gyp ERR! stack     at emitOne (events.js:90:13)
gyp ERR! stack     at Socket.emit (events.js:182:7)
gyp ERR! stack     at Pipe._onclose (net.js:484:12)
gyp ERR! System FreeBSD 10.3-RELEASE
gyp ERR! command "/usr/local/bin/node" "/usr/home/fusion809/atom-1.7.4/build/node_modules/npm/node_modules/node-gyp/bin/node-gyp.js" "rebuild"
gyp ERR! cwd /usr/home/fusion809/atom-1.7.4/build/node_modules/minidump
gyp ERR! node -v v5.11.1
gyp ERR! node-gyp -v v2.0.2
gyp ERR! not ok 
npm ERR! FreeBSD 10.3-RELEASE
npm ERR! argv "/usr/local/bin/node" "/usr/home/fusion809/atom-1.7.4/build/node_modules/.bin/npm" "--userconfig=/usr/home/fusion809/atom-1.7.4/build/.npmrc" "install" "--loglevel" "error"
npm ERR! node v5.11.1
npm ERR! npm  v2.13.3
npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE

npm ERR! runas@3.1.1 install: `node-gyp rebuild`
npm ERR! Exit status 1
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! Failed at the runas@3.1.1 install script 'node-gyp rebuild'.
npm ERR! This is most likely a problem with the runas package,
npm ERR! not with npm itself.
npm ERR! Tell the author that this fails on your system:
npm ERR!     node-gyp rebuild
npm ERR! You can get their info via:
npm ERR!     npm owner ls runas
npm ERR! There is likely additional logging output above.

npm ERR! Please include the following file with any support request:
npm ERR!     /usr/home/fusion809/atom-1.7.4/build/npm-debug.log
```

npm-debug.log can be found [here](http://paste2.org/tfDc67tg). I have noticed some other Python issues, like I tried to upload my build log to paste2.org using `pastebinit` but it gave the error:

``` bash
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/bin/pastebinit", line 27, in <module>
    from ConfigParser import SafeConfigParser
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/ConfigParser.py", line 91, in <module>
    from collections import OrderedDict as _default_dict
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/collections.py", line 4, in <module>
    from _abcoll import *
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/_abcoll.py", line 70, in <module>
    Iterable.register(str)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/abc.py", line 107, in register
    if not isinstance(subclass, (type, types.ClassType)):
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'ClassType'
```

so I am guessing that I am missing some Python2 package?

Thanks for your time,
Brenton

data.title: vertical scrollbar bug in windows 7
data.body:
Sometimes, the scroll box on atom in windows 7 does not reach the bottom of the scroll bar and does not touch the bottom arrow of the scroll bar. When this happens you can also drag the scroll box by dragging the empty space below it. I tried this on v1.8.0-beta4 and v1.7.4. I thought that uninstalling 1.7.4 and clearing atom folders, and then installing the beta would fix it but it didn't.
![scroll-bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11145398/15774820/07cf7b18-29b1-11e6-8074-4259494c35bd.PNG)

data.title: sudo atom -a file open in new window (not in window already open)
data.body:
### Description

sudo atom -a file open in new window (not in window already open)

```
$ atom --help
  -a, --add  Open path as a new project in last used window.  [boolean]
```
### Steps to Reproduce

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

atom -a file1 ( first time open in new window of atom )
atom -a file2 ( second time open in window already open of atom )
sudo atom -a file3  ( Third time open in new window of sudo atom )
sudo atom -a file4  ( Fourt time open in window already open of sudo atom )

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

atom -a file1 ( first time open in new window of atom )
atom -a file2 ( second time open in window already open of atom )
sudo atom -a file3  ( Third time open in window already open of atom )
sudo atom -a file4  ( Fourth time open in window already open of atom )
### Versions

```
$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.7.3
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
```

```
usuario at wicope in ~
$ apm --version
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.6
git 1.9.1
```

```
usuario at wicope in ~
$ uname -a
Linux wicope 3.13.0-76-lowlatency #120+7.0trisquel2 SMP PREEMPT Tue Jan 19 19:55:06 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

```
$ lsb_release -a
No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID: Trisquel
Description:    Trisquel GNU/Linux 7.0, Belenos
Release:    7.0
Codename:   belenos
```

data.title: Python raw string broken
data.body:
### Description

The Python Language's raw string functionality is broken
### Steps to Reproduce

``` Python
print(r"\")
```

**Expected behavior:** String stops there because of the `r`.

**Actual behavior:** Atom language thinks the string continues, regardless of the `r`.
### Versions

apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 3.5.1
git 2.8.1.windows.1
visual studio
windows 10

data.title: cmd+` doesn't switch between windows consistently
data.body:
Two different directories opened with `atom .` cmd+` only works on the first window that opens. Once the second window is shown it wont switch back. Can consistently switch to the second window from the first window.

Version: 1.7.4
OS: osx 10.11.5

Tried in safe mode, same issue. Other apps work correctly.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24781/15766826/a7efbf32-28f7-11e6-9450-6615555a573a.png)

data.title: Atom not displaying in ubuntu Xfce desktop environment
data.body:
### Description

When launching atom under Ubuntu Xfce desktop environment, atom window never shows up, and no errors are displayed.  Tried version 1.7.4 .deb package first, then tried cloning 1.8.0-beta4 from the repo and building. Both versions had the exact same problem.  After running the atom command it displays the app load time and then just sits there and the window never comes up.

I am using ubuntu server with the Xfce desktop manager over an x2go connection.

I have also tested it over tightvnc and with KDE4 (with both x2go and tightvnc) with the exact same results.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Install latest .deb package or build from source
2. Run atom command
3. Atom editor window never displays

**Expected behavior:** Atom window shows up.

**Actual behavior:** Atom window never shows up.
### Versions

Atom: 1.7.4 and 1.8.0-beta4
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome: 47.0.25.26.110
Node: 5.1.1
Ubuntu: server 14.04.4 LTS
Xfce: 4.10
